episode_title: 417 - The One With The Free Porn

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is watching TV, and we hear Mr. Treeger in the bathroom.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger
content.text: Ohhh, man!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What is that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Treeger’s snaking the shower drain.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger
content.text: What in the name of hell?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe he found you flip-flop.
(Joey sits down and changes the channel, and we see two people making out.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa! Is this porn? What did I do? I must’ve hit something on the remote.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do we pay for this?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, we didn’t even pay our cable bill—maybe this is how they punish us.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Maybe we shouldn’t pay our phone bill—free phone sex.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe we shouldn’t pay our gas bill? (Stops and thinks about what he just said.)

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger
content.text: Whoa, hey, that lady’s all kinds of naked.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, Joey just pressed something on the remote and it just, came on!

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger
content.text: Yeah, it happened to me once. I was just flipping through the channels and bam! It was like finding money.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Like finding money with naked people on it!

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger
content.text: Then I made the mistake of turning off the TV, I never got it back again. And I’m sad. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why would he turn off the TV? (Chandler shrugs.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s erm, Chandler and Joey’s, later that morning. The porn is still on, there are three women getting ready to shave the chest of some guy. Joey and Chandler are wondering why that guy is letting them shave his chest, and Monica and Rachel are eating breakfast at the foosball table.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, y’know what, come on, do we really have to watch this while we eat? (She makes a move for the remote.)

content.speaker: Joey and Chandler
content.text: Oh no-no-no-no!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We don’t know what could make this go away.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, so no one touches the remote. And no one touches the TV!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And no one touches the air around the TV!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Imagine a protective porn bubble if you will, okay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well at least, I’m going to mute it.

content.speaker: Joey and Chandler
content.text: Oh no-no-no! (Monica mutes the TV and they tentatively look behind them)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We still have porn.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, what are you doing? That’s too heavy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Give it here. (She takes the table.) Oh, God. (And gives it to Monica right away.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, I’m getting too pregnant for this, lugging around a stupid massage table. Y’know, I have to find a job where I carrying a smaller table. (She goes over and stands in front of the TV.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Or a job where you don’t have to carry a table.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You mean like a doctor?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs! You’re blocking the porn! Look out!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh! (She moves.) Oh my. Oh, that reminds me, I have to see my OB-GYN today.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s erm, Monica and Rachel’s, Ross is entering.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So uh, Emily just went to the airport.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh. Why didn’t you take her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Eh, her-her uncle already had planned on doing it. And y’know, we-we said our good-byes this morning, so…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You must feel horrible. Hey! The guys have free porn!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, cheer up! You’re gonna see her again, right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I, that’s the thing, I don’t know! I mean, whenever I brought it up with her she said, (In a British accent.) “This is so fantastic! Why do we have to talk about the future? Let’s just enjoy…”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No-no-no, don’t-don’t do the accent. You’ve got to see her again.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And why do you care so much?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because! You could get to live out my fantasy!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You had fantasies about Emily?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! Y’know, the fantasy! Meet someone from a strange land, fall in madly love, and spend the rest of your lives together.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is that why in junior high you were the only one that hung out with that Ukrainian kid?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah that, plus his mom used to put sour cream on everything!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ahh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you love her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We said it was only going to be two weeks, y’know?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You love her!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What-what is love really?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohhh, I knew you loved her! Then you need to go to the airport and tell her. You’re probably just gonna catch her just as she’s about to go to the gate. You’re gonna call out her name and say, “I love you!” And she’s gonna say, “I love you, too!” And you guys are going to have the most amazing kiss, everyone at the gate will applaud.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I am a good kisser.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Then you two can, can sneak into the cockpit, and things will start to heat up, and then a stewardess comes in… (Ross looks at her.) I’ve been watching too much porn.

content.description: Beth Israel Medical Center, Phoebe is at her OB-GYN doing an ultrasound, Rachel is with her. We here the baby’s heartbeat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Is that the heartbeat?

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: That’s it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wow! This is so cool.
(The heartbeat changes, and we hear a different one.)

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: Have we talked about the possibility of multiple births?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why don’t take care of this one, and should I get pregnant again, I’ll hold onto your card, okay?

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: No, I’m getting three separate heartbeats.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Three? You guys were worried I wouldn’t even have one!

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: Doctors are wrong all the time.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, so, are-are you sure that there are three?!

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: Definitely. (Points out each head on the ultrasound.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! Oh my God! Oh my God!! So I-I mean so in a few months I’m going to have three full grown babies just walkin’ around inside me?! Oh! Oh! And it’s gonna be one of those log rides where they just come shooting out!

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: Actually, giving birth to three babies isn’t that different from giving birth to one.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What do you know?!

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is there, waiting to tell Frank and Alice the news.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Oh-oh, Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh! Hi!

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Hi! (She runs over and hugs Phoebe’s stomach.) So, how did it go at the doctors?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh well, okay, hey, y’know how when you’re umm, you’re walking down the street and you see three people in a row, and you say, “Oh, that’s nice?”

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, yeah well, good news, you’re going to have three babies.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Three babies?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: I finally got my band!

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: We’re gonna have a big family, I’ve always wanted a big family!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh God, I’m so glad you guys are happy, I was so afraid you were going to be all freaked.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Why would we be freaked?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, no maybe ‘cause it’s harder to raise them, and the added expense, and…

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, back to happy. Back to happy!

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: No-no-no, no, it’s going to be fine. Because umm, because I teach Home Ec, and uh, I can have 30 kids making baby clothes all year long. Y’know it’ll-it’ll be like my very own little sweatshop.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah, I’ve been thinking ever since you said we were having triplets, the best thing for me to do is to drop out of college and get a job.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: No, Frank.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No you can’t quit college! No! You’re in college? Really?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah, refrigerator college.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah, y’know when we found out we were going to have a baby, y’know I figured y’know like I should y’know have like a career—and I love refrigerators!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You can’t give up on your dream.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: No, it’s okay. We’re-we’re gonna have three kids! And that’s-that’s a different kind of dream. Three kids and no money.

content.description: The airport, Emily is getting ready to board her flight to London.

content.speaker: Ticket Agent
content.text: This is the boarding call for Flight 009.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Emily! (Runs up.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Oh my God! What are you doing here? (They hug)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just, I had to see you one more time before you took-off.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: You are so sweet. (They kiss.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s, that’s, that’s a big candy bar. (She’s holding one of those huge Toblerone bars.) I had the most amazing time with you.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Me too.

content.speaker: Ticket Agent
content.text: This is the final boarding call for Flight 009.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Well, that’ me. (They kiss again.) Here, have this. (She gives him the candy bar.) I’m only allowed one piece of carryon anyway. (She starts towards the jetway.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait uh, listen. I-I, I have to tell you something. Umm, I’ve been thinking, I’m just gonna come out and say it. Okay? I-I-I ah, I-I think I love you.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Oh. (She’s shocked and hugs him.) Thank you. (She boards the plane.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s no problem.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Rachel is singing some kind of song.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s that song? It has been in my head all day long.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s the theme from Good Will Humping.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know who doesn’t even like dirty movies? My new boyfriend Joshua.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, he told me. He prefers to leave certain things to the imagination.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-oh, yeah, and did he also say that ah, some of the dialogue was corny and that he actually found it was funny and not sexy?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, he likes porn.
(Rachel starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Where ya going?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m going to find out if he really thinks supermodels are too skinny. (As she exits, Phoebe enters.) Hey, Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How did it go with Frank and Alice?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, Frank has to quit college because his super fertile sister is having three babies! I need to make a lot of money really fast, and I had an idea that I want to talk to you (Points to Chandler) about, ‘cause you work for a big company. Okay, insider trading, what information is there that you can give me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They don’t really talk to us about that kind of stuff. I can get you some free white out though.
(Ross enters.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh! Did you do what I said? Did-did-did you tell her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I did.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And well, what did she say?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, you’re totally welcome! What’d she say?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She said, “Thank you.” I said, “I love you.” And she said, “Thank you.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa-whoa, wait a minute, did you say, you love her?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, what were you trying to get her to do?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What do I do now?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You play hard to get.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She already lives in London.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Then you go to Tokyo.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right look, forget it, forget it. You told her you love her, it’s over.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It is not over! You’re over!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (Pause) Good one.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It is not over because she is going to call you and tell you she loves you. And the reason why she couldn’t, is because her feelings were so strong, it scared her. Now you go home and wait for her call, she could be calling you from the plane! Come on now go! Go! (Tries to push Ross out the door.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay! Okay! But if she doesn’t call, it is definitely over! No, wait. Wait. Unless, eventually, I call her, y’know just to she what’s going on, and, and she says she’ll call me back, but then she doesn’t. Then it’s over.
(Joey holds his fist up, and Chandler gives him two thumbs up.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Way to be strong, man!
(Ross leaves, and after the door closes, Joey gives him the loser sign.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s erm, Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler and Joey enter having just woken up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi! Listen, can we watch cartoons on your television? We need a porn break. We spent the last two hours watching In & Out & In, Again.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, so, why don’t you just turn it off?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because then we would be the guys who turned off free porn.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, good, you’re hear! Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, what-what ‘cha got there?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh this, well I’m glad you asked. (She opens the case and removes a knife and an soda can.) Now, don’t you hate it when you have to cut a tin can with an ordinary steak knife? (She efficiently cuts it in half.) Ahh! Now, I know what you’re thinking…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pregnant Woman Slays Four?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, they didn’t make you pay for those knives, did they?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you sure?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, you’re not gonna make enough money to help Frank and Alice just by selling knives.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no, I know that, but I just have to make enough money for the second part of my plan.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s the second part of your plan?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: My Saturn dealership.

content.description: Ross’s bedroom, he has fallen asleep waiting for Emily to call. He is awaken by the phone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Emily, hi! Uh, how-how was you flight?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: It was dreadful. I felt terrible about how I acted when you said those wonderful things.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, that-that, that’s all right. Umm, I’m just glad you called.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Ross umm, there’s something that I’ve got to tell you, there’s-there’s someone else.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Does that mean the same thing in England as it does in America?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Ross is relating his recent conversation with Emily to the gang.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She doesn’t know which one of us she wants, me or this Colin guy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This isn’t how it’s supposed to go, there can’t be another guy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Of course there’s another guy!! This is even more perfect! Now you have to prove your love!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m not proving anything. Okay, I’m done listening to you. If I hadn’t let you talk me into going to the airport in the first place, I never would’ve put my fist through the wall!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You put your fist through the wall?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I missed and hit the door. But, it opened really hard!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You have to go to London!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, you have to go fight for her!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, sure, that makes sense. Yeah. ‘Cause you already told her you love her and she didn’t say it back, then she called you and told you that there’s another guy, so yeah, go to London that’ll scare her!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: When Rachel was with Paulo, what did you do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I made fun of his accent.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You sat back and let him have her, you didn’t fight at all. Am I right? Do you want the same thing to happen with Emily?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right then, go fight for her! Go to London! I mean, that could be you and Emily! (Points to the TV.) That, but-but nicer. Just, go to London!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on! Surprise her! Show up at her doorstep! Don’t let her go without a fight!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right. All right, I’m gonna do it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m gonna, I’m gonna go to London and I’m going to fight for her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, good luck!
(Ross starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross! Ross! If you’re going to the airport, could you pick me up another one of those Toblerone bars? (Chandler nods his head no.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s erm, Monica and Rachel’s, Monica, Joey, and Chandler are sitting and talking as Phoebe and Rachel enter.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh-Ooh! I did it! I did it! I figured out a way to make money! I’m gonna open up my own massage place and Frank’s gonna help me! And! We can work it around his schedule so he doesn’t have to quit school!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s sounds great, but how are you going to afford it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, we were walking down the street and we saw that van that you guys used for catering and we realised…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m telling it! I’m telling it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. You know how people need transportation, but they also need massages to help them relax so I just figured we could combine the two, okay, I give the massages and Frank drives! I can fix up the van, bolt the table in the back, and you know what I’ve got?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: A place where no one will ever get out alive?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! Think about it, it’s a taxi that people take when they need to relax, it’s…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Relaxi-Taxi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: The name was my favourite part!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, well I can up with it!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: YOU DID NOT !!!! Oh! No! You came up with Relaxi Cab! That’s not good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I…
(The phone rings and Monica answers it.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! Ross, are you in England? Was Emily surprised?
[Cut to Ross in one of those British phone booths.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, because she hasn’t come home yet. And she hasn’t been home all night! She’s obviously staying with that other guy, and I’m the stupid moron who spent the whole night outside her apartment!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right. When is, when is the next flight out?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: About four hours.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, just stay there a couple more hours and if she doesn’t show up by then, then just come on home.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, tell him about Relaxi-Taxi, and-and ask him if he thinks that’s better than Relaxi Cab.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, it’s not Relaxi Cab. It’s Relaxicab, like taxicab.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, that is better.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s erm, Chandler and Joey’s, later that same night. There is a knock on the door and Chandler answers it to reveal Emily standing behind it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are we in London?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you doing here? You can’t be here!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I’ve uh, I’ve come to talk to Ross.
(She sets her bag down on the foosball table and Joey sees the Toblerone bar sticking out of it and gazes longingly at it.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nothing. No, nothing.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I was going to call him, but…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, you came to tell him you love him! I knew it! (Points at Chandler) I was right! (Points to Emily) I’m right, right?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I’d really rather talk to him.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I uh, I’ve been to his apartment and he wasn’t there, and uh. I need to talk to him, so do you have any idea where he is?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Ross, are you there? Ross, I don’t know if you can hear this but… (Ross has moved to the window, apparently so that he can hear better.) I’m gonna talk anyway, uh, I’m in the States with you sister and your friends and it’s all over with Colin. I came here to tell you that, and to tell you—Yes, Joey you can have all the chocolate you want, just take it! Uh, I came here to tell you that I love you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I love you too! I’m, I’m gonna call you right now from the phone booth! (Realises) You can’t hear me. (Goes to make his call.)
content.parenthetical: yelling, thinking Emily can hear him through the answering machine all the way to New York.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I wish I could know if you’d heard any of that. I suppose I’ve either just told you I love you or given my neighbours a good laugh. Mrs. Newman if you’re listening, bugger off this in none of your business. I suppose there’s not much chance you did heard that, and there’s the call waiting so, I should go. Oh well. (Answers the call waiting.) Hello.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Ross, I love you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh! Thank you.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is still watching the porn as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I was just at the bank, and there was this really hot teller, and she didn’t ask me to go do it with her in the vault.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Same kind of thing happened to me! Woman pizza delivery guy come over, gives me the pizza, takes the money, and leaves!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What, no, “Nice apartment, I bet the bedrooms are huge?”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Noo! Nothing!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what, we have to turn off the porn.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I think you’re right.
(Goes over and picks up the remote.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, ready?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: One.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Two.

content.speaker: Both
content.text: Three.
(Chandler turns off the porn and sets the remote down.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s kinda nice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, that’s kinda a relief.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.
(Pause.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You wanna see if we still have it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.
(Chandler turns on the TV and…)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: FREE PORN!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We have free porn here!!!
